sen.j: 一円硬貨（いちえんこうか）は、日本政府発行の補助硬貨。
sen.e: The one-yen coin is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.
The one-yen coin is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.
The one-yen coin is a subsidiary coin issued by the Japanese government.

sen.j: 一円玉（いちえんだま）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is called 'ichi en koka' or 'ichi en dama' in Japanese.
sen.cmt: 「一 円硬貨」、「一円玉」をローマ字で併記しました。
sen.e: It is called 'ichi en koka' or 'ichi en dama' in Japanese.
It is called 'ichi en koka' or 'ichi en dama' in Japanese.

sen.j: 硬貨の中で最も製造枚数が多い。
sen.e: It has the highest mintage of any current coins.
It has the highest mintage of any current coin.
It has the highest mintage of any current coin.

sen.j: 表面には「日本国」と「一円」そして「若木」が、裏面には「1」と製造年がデザインされている。
sen.e: On the head side are designed 'Japan' and 'one yen' (both in kanji) and a sapling, and on the tail side the number 'one' and the year of mintage.
On the head side are the designs for 'Japan', 'one yen' (both in kanji) and a sapling, while on the tail side is the number 'one' and the year of mintage.
On the head side are the designs for 'Japan', 'one yen' (both in kanji) and a sapling, while on the tail side is the number 'one' and the year of mintage.

sen.j: 発行される前年の1954年、この一円硬貨と（旧）五十円硬貨のデザインが戦後初めて一般公募された。
sen.e: In 1954, one year before it was issued, designs of this one-yen coin and (former) 50-yen coin were sought from the public for the first time after the war.
In 1954, one year before it was issued, designs for this one-yen coin and (former) 50-yen coin were sought from the public for the first time after the war.
In 1954, one year before it was issued, designs for this one-yen coin and (former) 50-yen coin were sought from the public for the first time after the war.

sen.j: 40日間の公募期間で、一円硬貨だけで2,581点の応募があった。
sen.e: During the 40-day public offer period, there were 2,581 applications for one-yen coin only.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the 40-day period of public appeal, there were 2,581 applications for the one-yen coin alone.
During the 40-day period of public appeal, there were 2,581 applications for the one-yen coin alone.

sen.j: 表の「若木」のデザインは当時京都府在住の中村雅美のものが、裏の「1」のデザインは当時大阪府在住の高島登二雄のものが、それぞれ選ばれた。
sen.e: The sapling on the head side was designed by Masami NAKAMURA who lived in Kyoto Prefecture then, and number '1' on the tail side was designed by Toshio TAKASHIMA who lived in Osaka Prefecture then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The sapling on the head side was designed by Masami NAKAMURA who lived in Kyoto Prefecture at the time, and the number '1' on the tail side was designed by Toshio TAKASHIMA who lived in Osaka Prefecture at the time.

The sapling on the head side was designed by Masami NAKAMURA who lived in Kyoto Prefecture at the time, and the number '1' on the tail side was designed by Toshio TAKASHIMA who lived in Osaka Prefecture at the time.

sen.j: ちなみに若木のデザインのモデルは特になく、特定のモデルがないからこそ却ってどの木にも通じる、という考え方である。
sen.e: There were no models for the sapling design, but the concept is that, because there is no particular model, it can be related to any trees.
There was no specific model for the sapling design, instead the concept is that, because there is no particular model, it can be related to any tree.
There was no specific model for the sapling design, instead the concept is that, because there is no particular model, it can be related to any tree.

sen.j: 消費税導入前はスーパーマーケットなどで細々と流通している程度であったが、導入以降は五円硬貨とともに流通量が激増したため、特に平成に入ってから大量に製造されている。
sen.e: Before the consumption tax was introduced, the coin were sparsely used in supermarkets etc. but after the tax was introduced, the supply significantly increased as well as that of five-yen coin, so they are minted in high volumes especially in Heisei period.

Before the consumption tax was introduced, the coins were sparsely used in supermarkets etc., however, after the tax was introduced, the supply significantly increased as well as that of five-yen coins, so they began to be minted in high volume especially during the Heisei period.

Before the consumption tax was introduced, the coins were sparsely used in supermarkets etc., however, after the tax was introduced, the supply significantly increased as well as that of five-yen coins, so they began to be minted in high volume especially during the Heisei period.

sen.j: しかし消費税が3％から5％に増税された1997年以降はあまり必要性が無くなったため製造量を減らし始めている。
sen.e: Since 1997, when the consumption tax was increased from 3% to 5%, however, their need decreased and the mintage is decreasing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since 1997, when the consumption tax was increased from 3% to 5%, however, their need has decreased and so has their mintage.
Since 1997, when the consumption tax was increased from 3% to 5%, however, their need has decreased and so has their mintage.

sen.j: 特に2001年（平成13年）は800万枚程度しか製造されなかったため、同年製造の分は未使用であれば古銭商などで（額面に比べれば）比較的高値で取引されている。
sen.e: Especially in 2001, only about 8 million coins were minted, so coins manufactured in that year are traded at relatively high price (compared to the face value) in old coin shops etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Especially in 2001, only about 8 million coins were minted, so coins manufactured in that year are traded at relatively high prices (compared to their face value) in old coin shops etc.
Especially in 2001, only about 8 million coins were minted, so coins manufactured in that year are traded at relatively high prices (compared to their face value) in old coin shops etc.

sen.j: 一円硬貨1枚を製造するのにかかるコストは1円以上で、造れば造るほど赤字となっているという話は有名である。
sen.e: It is well known that the cost to mint a one-yen coin is higher than one yen, and the more they mint, the more they loose money.
It is well known that the cost to mint a one-yen coin is higher than one yen, and the more they mint, the more money they lose.
It is well known that the cost to mint a one-yen coin is higher than one yen, and the more they mint, the more money they lose.

sen.j: 原料となるアルミニウムの原価だけで1枚あたり0.7円程度かかっており、そこから1円玉として出来上がるまでに1枚あたり1.6～1.8円程度のコストがかかっていると言われている。
sen.e: Just the cost of the raw material, aluminum, is about 0.7 yen, and it is said that the cost is around 1.6 - 1.8 yen to finish manufacturing a one-yen coin.
The cost of the raw material, aluminum, alone is about 0.7 yen, and it is said that the cost is around 1.6 - 1.8 yen to finish manufacturing a one-yen coin.
The cost of the raw material, aluminum, alone is about 0.7 yen, and it is said that the cost is around 1.6 - 1.8 yen to finish manufacturing a one-yen coin.

sen.j: 現在では1枚製造するのに2円のコストがかかると言われている。
sen.e: Currently, it is said the cost to mint one coin is two yen.
Currently, it is said the cost to mint one coin is two yen.
Currently, it is said the cost to mint one coin is two yen.

sen.j: 1870年：旧一円銀貨発行。
sen.e: 1870: Former one-yen silver coin was issued.
1870: Former one-yen silver coin was issued.
1870: Former one-yen silver coin was issued.

sen.j: 1871年：旧一円金貨（本位金貨）発行。
sen.e: 1871: Former one-yen gold coin (standard gold coin) was issued.
1871: Former one-yen gold coin (standard gold coin) was issued.
1871: Former one-yen gold coin (standard gold coin) was issued.

sen.j: 1874年：新一円銀貨発行。
sen.e: 1874: New one-yen silver coin was issued.
1874: New one-yen silver coin was issued.
1874: New one-yen silver coin was issued.

sen.j: 1948年：一円黄銅貨発行。
sen.e: 1948: One-yen brass coin was issued.
1948: One-yen brass coin was issued.
1948: One-yen brass coin was issued.

sen.j: なおこの一円黄銅貨は戦後発行であるが、素材金属価格の高騰により鋳つぶしされる危険があるため、失効した。
sen.e: This one-yen brass coin was issued after the war, but because there was a risk that the coins may be melted due to increase of the price of the raw material metal.
This one-yen brass coin was issued after the war, but because there was a risk that the coins may be melted due to an increase in price for the raw metal, production was ceased.
This one-yen brass coin was issued after the war, but because there was a risk that the coins may be melted due to an increase in price for the raw metal, production was ceased.

sen.j: 1955年：現行一円アルミニウム貨発行。
sen.e: 1955: Current one-yen aluminum coin was issued.
1955: Current one-yen aluminum coin was issued.
1955: Current one-yen aluminum coin was issued.

sen.j: 1968年：1年間発行を休止。
sen.e: 1968: Issuance was stopped for one year.
1968: Issuance was stopped for one year.
1968: Issuance was stopped for one year.

sen.j: 従って昭和43年と刻印された一円硬貨は存在しない。
sen.e: Therefore, there are no one-yen coin on which 'Showa 43' is incused.
Therefore, there are no one-yen coins on which 'Showa 43' is incused.
Therefore, there are no one-yen coins on which 'Showa 43' is incused.
